alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 10:47PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cabell, north central Mingo, western Lincoln, northwestern Logan and eastern Wayne Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1047 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Ona to near Hamlin to Man. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Logan, Hamlin, Barboursville, Chapmanville, Ranger, Ona, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Harts, Chief Logan State, Holden, Gill, East Lynn Lake, Kiahsville, West Hamlin, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Mount Gay, Chauncey, Salt Rock and Pea Ridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 15 and 24. Route 119 between mile markers 14 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
